intro: Tinnea obovata, commonly known as the broad-leafed tinnea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its oval, leathery leaves that are dark green on top and lighter underneath. It produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom in the spring. Tinnea obovata is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and stream banks.
